conclusion: The graph represents the velocity-time graph of a particle moving in a straight line, symmetric about the dashed line.
Every instant t before the dashed line has a mirror instant t' after the line with the same speed but opposite direction.
For any displacement reached once during the left half of the graph, the particle will pass that same position again while turning back at the bottom of the curve where v = 0.
The particle will pass the same position a third time during the symmetric portion on the right half of the graph.
In the interval 0 to t1, the only way a point can be crossed three times is if the particle first moves forward from its initial point.
The particle reverses direction at the instant where v = 0, the deepest point of the curve.
The particle retraces the path past the same point once more while moving forward again during the right half of the symmetric graph.
The three-crossings positions are those located between the starting point and the furthest point reached at the instant where v = 0.
Each of these points is encountered on the outbound trip, at the turnaround (v = 0), and on the inbound trip after the turnaround.
